examples: in 1918 Kaiser Wilhelm abdicated as German emperor
Ferdinand abdicated the throne in favor of the emperor's brother

verb.description: Fail to fulfill or undertake (a responsibility or duty)
examples: the government was accused of abdicating its responsibility
the secretary of state should not abdicate from leadership on educational issues

origin: Mid 16th century: from Latin abdicat- renounced, from the verb abdicare, from ab- away, from + dicare declare.
